sections.title: Installation
sections.content: Chameleon - Multipurpose Template & Page Builder, we have used php as backednd for Generating dynamic html, So its require a server to run(apache) . Inorder to install it just put it inside htdocs or /var/www folder. Finally make sure that if there in write permission inside sourcecode and uploads

sections.title: Overview
sections.content:
Chameleon - Multipurpose Template & Page Builder is an app where you will be able to design page using Chameleon block,configure block finally designed page will be downloaded as HTML.

 

Initially there will be a containing some button at the bottom. Initially there is a button called "Content block", by clicking on content block there will be a popup

 

there are several blocks under Header, Toolbar, Content Section and footer, Under page there are several layouts. Onhover over the block there will be a add button. By clicking over add button that block will be added to canvas

Then there is  a button  "Page settings", By clicking the button there will be a popup

In the left panel there are necessary settings for page background and in the right panel added block will be listed there, you can order the block by simply drag and drop.

The next button is called the "Pages", By clicking on this button there will be popup

You will be able to change the page inline and also add new page.

sections.title: Create a page
sections.content:
By clicking on the button "Pages", there will be a popup 

you can add as number of pages as you wish, you can also clone any page. by clicking on edit the corresponding page will be loaded in the canvas

sections.title: Design a page
sections.content:
From the pages pop you need to select which page you want to edit. After selecting a page click on content block, there will a popoup. For example select from toolbar popup 

Then we are going to add menu block 

if you want to add menu or submenu then just click over the menu, then there will be a popup

in order to add new menu just type on the left panel and click save changes, and to order menu or submenu, simply drag and drop.
